self.__next_f.push([1,"Multi inputs are comprised of multiple constituent fields, only one of which is visible
at a given time. They are designed for situations where constituent inputs are shown or
hidden based on the value of another field. For example, consider an address form. If
the user chooses the USA as the country, the region input should show a list of states
and US territories; if the user instead chooses Canada, the region input should show a
list of Canadian provinces, etc.

Unlike everywhere else in Primer forms, constituent inputs are not directly passed a
`name` attribute. Instead, developers pass a `name` attribute to the multi input itself.
The multi input then automatically assigns each constituent input the same name. This is
done so that the multi input looks like a single field from the server's point of view.
Using the address form example from earlier, this means only one value - either a US state
or a Canadian provice - will be submitted to the server under the `region` key.

Actually, that's not quite true. Constituent inputs _are_ given a `name`, but it's added to
the input as the `data-name` attribute as a way to identify constituent inputs, and will not
be sent to the server."])

self.__next_f.push([1,"`Tooltip` only appears on mouse hover or keyboard focus and contain a label or description text. Use tooltips sparingly and as a last resort.
Use tooltips as a last resort. Please consider [Tooltips alternatives](https://primer.style/design/accessibility/tooltip-alternatives).

When using a tooltip, follow the provided guidelines to avoid accessibility issues:
- Tooltips should contain only **non-essential text**. Tooltips can easily be missed and are not accessible on touch devices so never use tooltips to convey critical information.
- `Tooltip` should be rendered through the API of {{#link_to_component}}Primer::ButtonComponent{{/link_to_component}}, {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Beta::Link{{/link_to_component}}, or {{#link_to_component}}Primer::IconButton{{/link_to_component}}. Avoid using `Tooltip` a standalone component unless absolutely necessary (and **only** on interactive elements).
- Tooltip text must be brief and concise even when used to display a description.
- Tooltips can only hold string content.
- Tooltips are not allowed on `disabled` elements because such elements are not keyboard-accessible. If you must set a tooltip on a disabled element, use `aria-disabled="true"` instead and programmatically disable the element.
- **Never set tooltips on static, non-interactive elements** like `span` or `div`. Tooltips should only be used on interactive elements like buttons or links to avoid excluding keyboard-only
and screen reader users. Use of tooltips through {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Beta::Button{{/link_to_component}}, {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Beta::Link{{/link_to_component}}, or {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Beta::IconButton{{/link_to_component}} will guarantee this.
- If you must use `Tooltip` as a standalone component, place it immediately after the trigger element in the DOM. This allows screen reader users to navigate to the tooltip and copy its contents if desired.

Semantically, a tooltip will either act as an accessible name or an accessible description for the element that it is associated with resulting in either an
`aria-labelledby` or an `aria-describedby` association. The `type` drastically changes semantics and screen reader behavior so follow these guidelines carefully:
- When there is already a visible label text on the trigger element, the tooltip is likely intended be supplementary, so set `type: :description`.
The majority of tooltips will fall under this category.
- When there is no visible text on the trigger element and the tooltip content is appropriate as a label for the element, set `type: :label`.
`label` type is usually only appropriate for an icon-only control."])

information.\",\"url\":\"/product/components/banner\"},{\"title\":\"Guidelines\",\"url\":\"/product/components/banner/guidelines\"},{\"title\":\"Accessibility\",\"url\":\"/product/components/banner/accessibility\"},{\"title\":\"AvatarStack\",\"description\":\"AvatarStack for a field.\",\"url\":\"/product/components/autocomplete\"},{\"title\":\"Guidelines\",\"url\":\"/product/components/autocomplete/guidelines\"},{\"title\":\"AnchoredOverlay\",\"description\":\"AnchoredOverlay opens an Overlay relative to the anchor position.\",\"url\":\"/product/components/anchored-overlay\"},{\"title\":\"Accessibility\",\"url\":\"/product/components/anchored-overlay/acessibility\"},{\"title\":\"ActionMenu\",\"description\":\"ActionMenu is composed of ActionList and Overlay patterns used for quick actions and selections.\",\"search_keywords\":[\"dropdown\",\"picker\",\"overflow\",\"menu\"],\"url\":\"/product/components/action-menu\"},{\"title\":\"Guidelines\",\"url\":\"/product/components/action-menu/guideilnes\"},{\"title\":\"Accessibility\",\"url\":\"/product/components/action-menu/accessibility\"},{\"title\":\"ActionList\",\"description\":\"ActionList is a vertical list of interactive actions or options. It's composed of items presented in a consistent, single-column format, with room for icons, descriptions, side information, and other rich visuals.\",\"url\":\"/product/components/action-list\"},{\"title\":\"Guidelines\",\"url\":\"/product/components/action-list/guidelines\"},{\"title\":\"Accessibility\",\"url\":\"/product/components/action-list/accessibility\"},{\"title\":\"ActionBar\",\"description\":\"A collection of horizontally aligned IconButtons. The IconButtons can be split into groups by adding a divider. When there is not enough space, IconButtons that don't fit will be added to an overflow menu.\",\"url\":\"/product/components/action-bar\"},{\"title\":\"Guidelines\",\"url\":\"/product/components/action-bar/guidelines\"},{\"title\":\"Accessibility\",\"url\":\"/product/components/action-bar/accessibility\"},{\"title\":\"Tooltips\",\"description\":\"Most UI cases don't call for Tooltips. Learn some alternative methods to use in place of Tooltips.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/tooltips\"},{\"title\":\"Accessibility tools\",\"description\":\"Tools to help you design accessible interfaces.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/tools\"},{\"title\":\"Toasts\",\"description\":\"GitHub no longer uses toasts because of their accessibility and usability issues.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/toasts\"},{\"title\":\"Text resize and respacing\",\"description\":\"People on the web should be able to resize text to improve legibility without blocking or obscuring any other part of the UI.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/text-resize-and-spacing\"},{\"title\":\"Semantic HTML\",\"description\":\"Understand when and how to use semantic HTML to improve the experience of the largest number of users possible.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/semantic-html\"},{\"title\":\"Placeholders\",\"description\":\"Placeholders have many accessibility and usability concerns to be aware of.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/placeholders\"},{\"title\":\"Links\",\"description\":\"Links help us navigate a website. Learn how to style links appropriately to keep them usable by all.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/links\"},{\"title\":\"Accessibility\",\"description\":\"How to create accessible interfaces for GitHub.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility\"},{\"title\":\"Icons\",\"description\":\"Icons may be use as visual cues to reinforce the meaning of adjacent text, or to convey meaning on their own.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/icons\"},{\"title\":\"Headings\",\"description\":\"Headings play a critical role in communicating the structure of a page. Find out why they're critical and how to create an accessible hierarchy in your pages.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/headings\"},{\"title\":\"Focus management\",\"description\":\"Managing focus within a page or application is essential for users to successfully navigate, complete actions, and understand where they are.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/focus-management\"},{\"title\":\"Descriptive buttons\",\"description\":\"Labeling buttons properly let's users know what will happen when they activate the control, lessens errors, and increases confidence.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/descriptive-buttons\"},{\"title\":\"Color considerations\",\"description\":\"Color is an important aspect of creating accessible, inclusive experiences.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/color-considerations\"},{\"title\":\"Assistive technology announcements\",\"description\":\"Events like toasts and status messages are visually communicated to GitHub users. Making sure those announcements are read via assistive technology allows users with low or no vision to get that status information.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/announcements\"},{\"title\":\"Alternative text for images\",\"description\":\"Alternative text on images allows assistive technology like screen readers to understand the purpose of an image on a page or allows them to skip it if purely decorative.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/alternative-text-for-images\"},{\"title\":\"Accessibility at GitHub\",\"description\":\"Get started with accessibility at GitHub.\",\"url\":\"/accessibility/accessibility-at-github\"},{\"title\":\"ActionBar\",\"description\":\"\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/actionbar\"},{\"title\":\"ActionList\",\"description\":\"An ActionList is a styled list of links. It acts as the base component for many\\nother menu-type components, including `ActionMenu` and `SelectPanel`, as well as\\nthe navigational component `NavList`.\\n\\nEach item in an action list can be augmented by specifying corresponding leading\\nand/or trailing visuals.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/action_list\"},{\"title\":\"ActionMenu\",\"description\":\"ActionMenu is used for actions, navigation, to display secondary options, or single/multi select lists. They appear when\\nusers interact with buttons, actions, or other controls.\\n\\nThe only allowed elements for the `Item` components are: `:a`, `:button`, and `:clipboard-copy`. The default is `:button`.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/action_menu\"},{\"title\":\"Banner\",\"description\":\"Use `Banner` to highlight important information.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/banner\"},{\"title\":\"ButtonMarketing\",\"description\":\"Use `ButtonMarketing` for actions (e.g. in forms). Use links for destinations, or moving from one page to another.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/button_marketing\"},{\"title\":\"CheckBox\",\"description\":\"Check boxes are true/false inputs rendered as `\u003cinput type=\\\"checkbox\\\"\u003e` in HTML.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/checkbox\"},{\"title\":\"CheckBoxGroup\",\"description\":\"Check box groups consist of one or more related check boxes.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/checkbox_group\"},{\"title\":\"Dialog\",\"description\":\"A `Dialog` is used to remove the user from the main application flow,\\nto confirm actions, ask for disambiguation or to present small forms.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/dialog\"},{\"title\":\"Dropdown\",\"description\":\"`Dropdown` is a lightweight context menu for housing navigation and actions.\\nThey're great for instances where you don't need the full power (and code) of the SelectMenu.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/dropdown\"},{\"title\":\"FormButton\",\"description\":\"A button input rendered using the HTML `\u003cbutton type=\\\"button\\\"\u003e` tag.\\n\\nThis component wraps the Primer button component and supports the same slots and arguments.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/form_button\"},{\"title\":\"FormControl\",\"description\":\"Wraps an input (or arbitrary content) with a label above and a caption and validation message beneath.\\n\\nNOTE: This `FormControl` component is designed for wrapping inputs that aren't supported by the Primer\\nforms framework.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/form_control\"},{\"title\":\"HellipButton\",\"description\":\"Use `HellipButton` to render a button with a hellip. Often used for hidden text expanders.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/hellip_button\"},{\"title\":\"HiddenTextExpander\",\"description\":\"Use `HiddenTextExpander` to indicate and toggle hidden text.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/hidden_text_expander\"},{\"title\":\"Image\",\"description\":\"Use `Image` to render images.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/image\"},{\"title\":\"Layout\",\"description\":\"`Layout` provides foundational patterns for responsive pages.\\n`Layout` can be used for simple two-column pages, or it can be nested to provide flexible 3-column experiences.\\n On smaller screens, `Layout` uses vertically stacked rows to display content.\\n\\n`Layout` flows as both column, when there's enough horizontal space to render both `Main` and `Sidebar`side-by-side (on a desktop of tablet device, per instance);\\nor it flows as a row, when `Main` and `Sidebar` are stacked vertically (e.g. on a mobile device).\\n`Layout` should always work in any screen size.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/page_layout\"},{\"title\":\"Menu\",\"description\":\"Use `Menu` to create vertical lists of navigational links.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/menu\"},{\"title\":\"MultiInput\",\"description\":\"$3a\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/multi_input\"},{\"title\":\"NavigationTab\",\"description\":\"This component is part of navigation components such as `Primer::Alpha::TabNav`\\nand `Primer::Alpha::UnderlineNav` and should not be used by itself.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/navigation_tab\"},{\"title\":\"OcticonSymbols\",\"description\":\"OcticonSymbols renders a symbol dictionary using a list of {{link_to_octicons}}.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/octicon_symbols\"},{\"title\":\"Overlay\",\"description\":\"Overlay components codify design patterns related to floating surfaces such\\nas dialogs and menus. They are private components intended to be used by\\nspecialized components, and mostly contain presentational logic and\\nbehavior.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/overlay\"},{\"title\":\"RadioButton\",\"description\":\"Radio buttons represent one of a set of options and are rendered as `\u003cinput type=\\\"radio\\\"\u003e` in HTML.\\n**NOTE**: You probably want to use the {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Alpha::RadioButtonGroup{{/link_to_component}}\\ncomponent instead, as it allows rendering a group of options.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/radio\"},{\"title\":\"RadioButtonGroup\",\"description\":\"A group of mutually exclusive radio buttons.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/radio_group\"},{\"title\":\"SegmentedControl\",\"description\":\"Use a segmented control to let users select an option from a short list and immediately apply the selection\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/segmented_control\"},{\"title\":\"Select\",\"description\":\"Select lists are single-line text inputs rendered as `\u003cselect\u003e` tags in HTML.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/select\"},{\"title\":\"SelectPanel\",\"description\":\"Select panels allow for selecting from a large number of options and can be thought of as a more capable\\nversion of the traditional HTML `\u003cselect\u003e` element.\\n\\nSelect panels:\\n\\n1. feature an input field at the top that allows an end user to filter the list of results.\\n1. can render their items statically or dynamically by fetching results from the server.\\n1. allow selecting a single item or multiple items.\\n1. permit leading visuals like Octicons, avatars, and custom SVGs.\\n1. can be used as form inputs in Rails forms.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/select_panel\"},{\"title\":\"Stack\",\"description\":\"Stack is a layout component that creates responsive horizontal and vertical flows.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/stack\"},{\"title\":\"StackItem\",\"description\":\"StackItem is a layout component designed to be used as the child of a Stack.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/stack_item\"},{\"title\":\"SubmitButton\",\"description\":\"A submit button input rendered using the HTML `\u003cbutton type=\\\"submit\\\"\u003e` tag.\\n\\nThis component wraps the Primer button component and supports the same slots and arguments.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/submit_button\"},{\"title\":\"TabContainer\",\"description\":\"Use `TabContainer` to create tabbed content with keyboard support. This component does not add any styles.\\nIt only provides the tab functionality. If you want styled Tabs you can look at {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Alpha::TabNav{{/link_to_component}}.\\n\\nThis component requires javascript.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/tab_container\"},{\"title\":\"TabNav\",\"description\":\"Use `TabNav` to style navigation with a tab-based selected state, typically used for navigation placed at the top of the page.\\nFor panel navigation, use {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Alpha::TabPanels{{/link_to_component}} instead.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/tab_nav\"},{\"title\":\"TabPanels\",\"description\":\"Use `TabPanels` for tabs with panel navigation.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/tab_panels\"},{\"title\":\"TextArea\",\"description\":\"Text areas are multi-line text inputs rendered using the `\u003ctextarea\u003e` tag in HTML.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/textarea\"},{\"title\":\"TextField\",\"description\":\"Text fields are single-line text inputs rendered as `\u003cinput type=\\\"text\\\"\u003e` in HTML.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/text_input\"},{\"title\":\"ToggleSwitch\",\"description\":\"The ToggleSwitch component is a button that toggles between two boolean states. It is meant to be used for\\nsettings that should cause an immediate update. If configured with a \\\"src\\\" attribute, the component will\\nmake a POST request containing data of the form \\\"value: 0 | 1\\\".\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/toggle_switch\"},{\"title\":\"Tooltip\",\"description\":\"$3b\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/tooltip\"},{\"title\":\"UnderlineNav\",\"description\":\"Use `UnderlineNav` to style navigation links with a minimal\\nunderlined selected state, typically placed at the top\\nof the page.\\n\\nFor panel navigation, use {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Alpha::UnderlinePanels{{/link_to_component}} instead.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/underline_nav\"},{\"title\":\"UnderlinePanels\",\"description\":\"Use `UnderlinePanels` to style tabs with an associated panel and an underlined selected state.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/underline_panels\"},{\"title\":\"AutoComplete\",\"description\":\"Use `AutoComplete` to provide a user with a list of selectable suggestions that appear when they type into the\\ninput field. This list is populated by server search results.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/autocomplete\"},{\"title\":\"Avatar\",\"description\":\"`Avatar` can be used to represent users and organizations on GitHub.\\n\\n- Use the default circle avatar for users, and the square shape\\nfor organizations or any other non-human avatars.\\n- By default, `Avatar` will render a static `\u003cimg\u003e`. To have `Avatar` function as a link, set the `href` which will wrap the `\u003cimg\u003e` in a `\u003ca\u003e`.\\n- Set `size` to update the height and width of the `Avatar` in pixels.\\n- To stack multiple avatars together, use {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Beta::AvatarStack{{/link_to_component}}.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/avatar\"},{\"title\":\"AvatarStack\",\"description\":\"Use `AvatarStack` to stack multiple avatars together.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/avatar_stack\"},{\"title\":\"BaseButton\",\"description\":\"Use `BaseButton` to render an unstyled `\u003cbutton\u003e` tag that can be customized.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/base_button\"},{\"title\":\"Blankslate\",\"description\":\"Use `Blankslate` when there is a lack of content within a page or section. Use as placeholder to tell users why something isn't there.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/blankslate\"},{\"title\":\"BorderBox\",\"description\":\"`BorderBox` is a Box component with a border.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/border_box\"},{\"title\":\"Breadcrumbs\",\"description\":\"Use `Breadcrumbs` to display page hierarchy.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/breadcrumbs\"},{\"title\":\"Button\",\"description\":\"Use `Button` for actions (e.g. in forms). Use links for destinations, or moving from one page to another.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/button\"},{\"title\":\"ButtonGroup\",\"description\":\"Use `ButtonGroup` to render a series of buttons.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/button_group\"},{\"title\":\"ClipboardCopy\",\"description\":\"Use `ClipboardCopy` to copy element text content or input values to the clipboard.\\n\\nThis component by itself is not styled as a button, and can therefore only be used in limited circumstances.\\nIf you're looking for a button, consider using {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Beta::ClipboardCopyButton{{/link_to_component}}\\ninstead.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/clipboard_copy\"},{\"title\":\"ClipboardCopyBaseButton\",\"description\":\"Internal\\n\\n:nodoc:\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/clipboard_copy_base_button\"},{\"title\":\"ClipboardCopyButton\",\"description\":\"`ClipboardCopyButton` uses the `ClipboardCopy` component to copy text to the clipboard,\\nstyled as a Primer button. It can be used wherever a button is desired, and works well\\nwith components like `ButtonGroup`.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/clipboard_copy_button\"},{\"title\":\"CloseButton\",\"description\":\"Use `CloseButton` to render an `` without default button styles.\\n\\n[0]: https://primer.style/view-components/system-arguments#html-attributes\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/close_button\"},{\"title\":\"Counter\",\"description\":\"Use `Counter` to add a count to navigational elements and buttons.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/counter_label\"},{\"title\":\"Details\",\"description\":\"Use `DetailsComponent` to reveal content after clicking a button.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/details\"},{\"title\":\"Heading\",\"description\":\"`Heading` should be used to communicate page organization and hierarchy.\\n\\n- Set tag to one of `:h1`, `:h2`, `:h3`, `:h4`, `:h5`, `:h6` based on what is appropriate for the page context.\\n- Use `Heading` as the title of a section or sub section.\\n- Do not use `Heading` for styling alone. For simply styling text, consider using {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Beta::Text{{/link_to_component}} with relevant {{link_to_typography_docs}}\\n such as `font_size` and `font_weight`.\\n- Do not jump heading levels. For instance, do not follow a `\u003ch1\u003e` with an `\u003ch3\u003e`. Heading levels should increase by one in ascending order.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/heading\"},{\"title\":\"IconButton\",\"description\":\"Use `IconButton` to render Icon-only buttons without the default button styles.\\n\\n`IconButton` will always render with a tooltip unless the tag is `:summary`.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/icon_button\"},{\"title\":\"Label\",\"description\":\"Use `Label` to add contextual metadata to a design.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/label\"},{\"title\":\"Link\",\"description\":\"Use `Link` for navigating from one page to another. `Link` styles anchor tags with default blue styling and hover text-decoration.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/link\"},{\"title\":\"Markdown\",\"description\":\"Use `Markdown` to wrap markdown content.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/markdown\"},{\"title\":\"NavList\",\"description\":\"`NavList` provides a simple way to render side navigation, i.e. navigation\\nthat appears to the left or right side of some main content. Each group in a\\nnav list is a list of links.\\n\\nNav list groups can contain sub items. Rather than navigating to a URL, groups\\nwith sub items expand and collapse on click. To indicate this functionality, the\\ngroup will automatically render with a trailing chevron icon that changes direction\\nwhen the group expands and collapses.\\n\\nNav list items appear visually active when selected. Each nav item must have one\\nor more ID values that determine which item will appear selected. Use the\\n`selected_item_id` argument to select the appropriate item.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/nav_list\"},{\"title\":\"Octicon\",\"description\":\"`Octicon` renders an {{link_to_octicons}} with {{link_to_system_arguments_docs}}.\\n`Octicon` can also be rendered with the `primer_octicon` helper, which accepts the same arguments.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/octicon\"},{\"title\":\"Popover\",\"description\":\"Use `Popover` to bring attention to specific user interface elements, typically to suggest an action or to guide users through a new experience.\\n\\nBy default, the popover renders with absolute positioning, meaning it should usually be wrapped in an element with a relative position in order to be positioned properly. To render the popover with relative positioning, use the relative property.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/popover\"},{\"title\":\"ProgressBar\",\"description\":\"Use `ProgressBar` to visualize task completion.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/progress_bar\"},{\"title\":\"RelativeTime\",\"description\":\"Formats a timestamp as a localized string or as relative text that auto-updates in the user's browser.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/relative_time\"},{\"title\":\"Spinner\",\"description\":\"Use `Spinner` to let users know that content is being loaded.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/spinner\"},{\"title\":\"State\",\"description\":\"Use `State` for rendering the status of an item.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/state_label\"},{\"title\":\"Subhead\",\"description\":\"Use `Subhead` as the start of a section. The `:heading` slot will render an `\u003ch2\u003e` font-sized text.\\n\\n- Optionally set the `:description` slot to render a short description and the `:actions` slot for a related action.\\n- Use a succinct, one-line description for the `:description` slot. For longer descriptions, omit the description slot and render a paragraph below the `Subhead`.\\n- Use the actions slot to render a related action to the right of the heading. Use {{#link_to_component}}Primer::ButtonComponent{{/link_to_component}} or {{#link_to_component}}Primer::Beta::Link{{/link_to_component}}.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/subhead\"},{\"title\":\"Text\",\"description\":\"`Text` is a wrapper component that will apply typography styles to the text inside.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/text\"},{\"title\":\"TimelineItem\",\"description\":\"Use `TimelineItem` to display items on a vertical timeline, connected by badge elements.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/timeline\"},{\"title\":\"Truncate\",\"description\":\"Use `Truncate` to shorten overflowing text with an ellipsis.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/truncate\"},{\"title\":\"Box\",\"description\":\"`Box` is a basic wrapper component for most layout related needs.\",\"url\":\"/product/getting-started/rails/components/box\"},{\"title\":\"ConditionalWrapper\",\"description\":\"Conditionally renders a component around the given content.
